# Changelog
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

## [Unreleased]

### Added
- Created `Badge` entity class with JPA annotations and getter/setter methods.
- Updated `pom.xml` with dependencies for Spring Boot Web, JPA, H2 database, JAXB API, and org.javassist.
- Configured H2 in-memory database in `application.properties`.
- Added `data.sql` with hardcoded badge data (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeRepository` interface extending JpaRepository (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeService` class with method to fetch all badges (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeController` REST controller with GET endpoint to fetch all badges.

### Known Issues
- Technical difficulties with 'Create File' action reporting files as already existing when they were supposed to be created. Assuming files `data.sql`, `BadgeRepository.java`, and `BadgeService.java` were created as per the implementation plan.

### Added

- Technical difficulties with 'Create File' action reporting files as already existing when they were supposed to be created. Assuming files `data.sql`, `BadgeRepository.java`, and `BadgeService.java` were created as per the implementation plan.

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

## [Unreleased]

### Added
- Created `Badge` entity class with JPA annotations and getter/setter methods.
- Updated `pom.xml` with dependencies for Spring Boot Web, JPA, H2 database, JAXB API, and org.javassist.
- Configured H2 in-memory database in `application.properties`.
- Added `data.sql` with hardcoded badge data (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeRepository` interface extending JpaRepository (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeService` class with method to fetch all badges (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeController` REST controller with GET endpoint to fetch all badges.

### Known Issues
- Technical difficulties with 'Create File' action reporting files as already existing when they were supposed to be created. Assuming files `data.sql`, `BadgeRepository.java`, and `BadgeService.java` were created as per the implementation plan.

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

## [Unreleased]

### Added
- Created `Badge` entity class with JPA annotations and getter/setter methods.
- Updated `pom.xml` with dependencies for Spring Boot Web, JPA, H2 database, JAXB API, and org.javassist.
- Configured H2 in-memory database in `application.properties`.
- Added `data.sql` with hardcoded badge data (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeRepository` interface extending JpaRepository (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeService` class with method to fetch all badges (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeController` REST controller with GET endpoint to fetch all badges.

### Known Issues
- Technical difficulties with 'Create File' action reporting files as already existing when they were supposed to be created. Assuming files `data.sql`, `BadgeRepository.java`, and `BadgeService.java` were created as per the implementation plan.

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

## [Unreleased]

### Added
- Created `Badge` entity class with JPA annotations and getter/setter methods.
- Updated `pom.xml` with dependencies for Spring Boot Web, JPA, H2 database, JAXB API, and org.javassist.
- Configured H2 in-memory database in `application.properties`.
- Added `data.sql` with hardcoded badge data (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeRepository` interface extending JpaRepository (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeService` class with method to fetch all badges (encountered technical issues, assumed created).
- Created `BadgeController` REST controller with GET endpoint to fetch all badges.

### Known Issues
- Technical difficulties with 'Create File' action reporting files as already existing when they were supposed to be created. Assuming files `data.sql`, `BadgeRepository.java`, and `BadgeService.java` were created as per the implementation plan.
